title: Monitor Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health (Athens, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Overall easy interview. Basic how did you learn of this position, what skills do you have… nothing to hard. Got offered a drink before going into the room with the manager.
Interview Questions: What ekg background do you have?

title: Registered Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Very quick and to the point, was supposed to have a second interview but ended up getting the job before that. I was interviewed by the supervisor and person whose job I was going to be replacing.
Interview Questions: What is your experience as a clinical dietitian?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Involved a couple of phone interviews, one with the manager and a second one with the manager and a floor leader and an in-person shadow experience before an offer was extended.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you experienced a difficult situation and how did you handle it?

title: Business Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: The overall process was easy and good. They made me feel comfortable and were very friendly. They made sure to explain everything throughly. I applied, got called pretty quickly to interview, did an online interview and then went in person. Got the job offer the following week.
Interview Questions: Strengths, weaknesses, why leaving current job.

title: Procurement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen by a Team Lead or Supervisor, then a competency test. Final interview was a panel of four to six team leads and supervisors. Questions where straight forward, they are very big on the S.T.A.R method of responding to questions.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation when you needed to work as team?

title: Data Integrity Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Newtown, PA) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: The fast & quick process was smooth and well. Need to have an understanding of EPIC. Also need to understand Revenue Management. Please apply for a z position like this and find out. Be Blessed.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience working with billing in the hospital or physician's office setting?

title: Business Development Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: I had one interview with the manager and it was quite interactive. They gave me an overview of the position and the team and the kind of work they do on a daily basis.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good fit for this position? Asked me in detail about my previous experience.

title: Operating Room Orderly Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Easy and quick interview. Hiring process was also very quick and easy. They do a good job at making you feel like you are a part of the team from the get go
Interview Questions: What do you think you bring to the team?

title: Sales Executive Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with 2 people. Started with recruiter and then went to the community executive director. Final was with the VP of sales and marketing. There were a series of questions asked by her and after that went back to recruiter and received and offer within a week
Interview Questions: Give an example of how you build relationships to gain sales

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Conshohocken, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and fast interview process. Everyone was very nice and would definitely interview the again. I interviewed with my manager, her boss, the person who was in charge of the program prior and one other person.
Interview Questions: What was your experience working with doctors?

title: Community Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Really long. Took many months to get hired and you have to do a presentation on the program to upper level management. They expect you to really know their program which is a challenge.
Interview Questions: Many questions around sales, objections and specifically about their program.

title: RN ICU Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview process wasn't bad. The director at holy cross silver spring ICU was very friendly. I was hired on the spot and toured the entire unit. Minimal questions asked since the director was very friendly.
Interview Questions: Why am I moving from Florida to Maryland? I explained that my family lived there. Minimal questions were asked since I was hired on the spot. The director mostly went over the information with me.

title: Certified Phlebotomsit Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Trinity Health in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Application . email and one o one interview, the entire process last around 3 weeks. Once started you spend one week studding rules and regulations, and another week shadowing someone else.
Interview Questions: What would be a good excuse to miss a day at work?

title: EMT-B Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: I had a video call interview, followed by an in person interview. Normal questions, nothing special. Had me do practice CPR with a mannequin. Then did a week long orientation.
Interview Questions: What do you think the hardest thing would be for you as an EMT?

title: Database Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone screen and then a team interview. Very clear and simple process. Took approximately three weeks from interview to offer. One of the best interview experiences I’ve had.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your work style.

title: RN Clinical Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Detroit, MI) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Screening first. Was contacted multiple times to arrange screening then was ghosted. My time is just as valuable if not more valuable than a recruiters so screen potential candidates better instead of shooting out mass emails. You ruined any chance of future employment with Trinity for me.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your management style.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: First phone call was with the recruiter asking very generic questions like if I’m authorized to work in the US and what experience I have with the position. Second phone call was with the manager basically just telling me what my responsibilities would be and discussing pay rate and benefits.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Detailed and thorough. The interviewers really like to make sure you understand the job and the expectations. It was professional. At first, there was an awkward silence in the room but it was short.
Interview Questions: How did I hear about the position?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview process went well. Every person I encountered in the process was very welcoming from management to peers. In person interview was conducted at the facility. Walk thru of the workspace was given.  Phone interview with HR after and offer made soon after.
Interview Questions:
What are the gaps in your resume?
Why are you leaving your previous position? 
What benches are you familiar with? 
What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: First the nurse recruiter sets up a 15-30 minute interview asking 3-4 questions regarding the role and then they will set up an interview with the nurse coordinator via zoom.
Interview Questions: What draws you to working at Trinity health

title: Medical Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy. There was an initial phone interview, then in person. Employer reached out with an offer within a week. In total, the entire process took about 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your past work experience

title: RN, Bsn Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Very pleasant and laid back. No ridiculous scenario questions. Just real talk with management. Very transparent about position and expectations so no double talk! One of the best interviews I've ever had.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for in an employer?

title: CT Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview with recruiter, questions from hiring manager, about a week in between offer extended. Overall, a good experience with any questions I had answered. Questions were straight forward.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation you encountered and how you worked to solve it?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews within two months....30 min interview for the first time zoom call...2 hour in person interview with loaded questions that they had and it was open ended with what was required with the position and what you wanted out of it
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Trinity

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: You have to complete a peer review interview with Manager and then 2/3 peers. Random questions asked. Why did you leave previous job? Name a situation where you had to make a quick decision on your own?
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Call Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Syracuse, NY) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Two part interview, one was virtual and the second part face to face with the manager of the call center who was kind and made me feel comfortable. I also shadowed one of the representatives for about a half hour to get an idea of day-to-day tasks.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with call centers

title: Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was over the phone due to the pandemic but I felt that it was still very professional and followed a process. They asked related questions to my skills that would be applied to the job and where I was hoping to be in the future with my career.
Interview Questions: Not applicable, I do not recall

title: Driver/Courier Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions:
Sr Recruiter never called me during the scheduled interview, instead I called in once I realized no one was calling. 

I also had my resume uploaded and application filled out, otherwise I wouldn't have been selected to interview. Recruiter had no idea where my information was. The ensuing questions were not interview like at all, just a scramble of confusion. 

The whole process was very un-professional.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience? (For a position that stated No experience was required)

title: RN Nurse Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Fort Gratiot, MI) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview started on time however a corporate Human Resource member showed up 15 minutes into the interview so questions/answers had to be repeated. Interview questions were read from a booklet.  All questions I asked they always turned back to staffing issues. They did give a tour of the facility. Didn’t see many employees on the tour, the ones I did see seemed friendly. Once completed they said they had more interviews throughout the week & id hear by the end of the week either way, I never received a call.
Interview Questions: You do know that assisted living facilities differ from long term care right?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Waterbury, CT) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and informative. Met with several different floors to find the right fit for what type of nursing I would like to go into. Was hired on my second interview. Very easy process
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 1 year, 5 years, 10years

title: Technology Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job and the recruiter contacted me. She asked me to do something which I couldn't and then she ghosts me. Does she expect me to fix their problems for free?
Interview Questions: Can you upload a resume?

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was lengthy but once you get offered a position you get your start date rather quickly. There are tons of paperwork that needs to be filled out and you need to verify you are who you are for work authorization purposes
Interview Questions: What made you apply to Trinity Health?

title: Health Information Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Informative.   Explained job duties, different hours available; holidays, weekends, experience, what was expected. Benefits package. Went over resume. Introduced themselves; was interviewed by two department managers.  Basically was shifting into another department, as I was an internal hire.
Interview Questions: What hours I want to work

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Muskegon, MI) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Structured, behavioral based. The was an initial interview with HR, second with the director and a third with members of the management staff and some of the staff.  From there I had a drug test and physical. After the results I was made an offer and given 5 days to consider
Interview Questions: What is your management style. How do you use it

title: Remote Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Philadelphia, PA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: I didn’t even apply a recruiter txt my phone asking if my name was —————— and I asked who’s speaking and he said he was a recruiter from trinity health. I asked him how he got my number and email he said from CareerBuilder. He offered me a job 20mins after the interview and then he said he will send a check via email to deposit in my bank to get the Mac book and system software where. I honestly think Is a scam so I have accepted the offer.
Interview Questions:
(1 )
Describe your Remote Administrative Assistant style?
What attributes of yours give you an edge over other contenders for this position?
What motivates you in your job?
What are you looking for in a company?
What are your career goals?
What is your typing speed?

title: OR Circulator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Columbus, OH) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and simple. Process was quick and papers were easy to fill out. I interviewed with clinical manager , manager, and director and then shadowed the department. After I shadowed, I let the manager know what I thought of the job
Interview Questions: How do you handle a difficult surgeon?

title: Monitor Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Bridgeport, CT) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was awesome. The manager was a delight to speak with. All of my questions were answered. The interview was so relaxed, but still professional and the team seemed great.
Interview Questions: Do you have any questions for me?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was relatively easy. The interviews were held via phone. They seemed pretty flexible and willing to work with my class schedule.  They also asked questions that were not too difficult to answer.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you came across an obstacle in a work setting.

title: RN/Grad Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with HR then interviewed with manager a week later. Not offered the hours I wanted so I declined the offer. Few weeks later got a call that a day shift position was opening if I was still interested.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with difficult patients?

title: Population Health Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: I spoke to a lovely lady who introduced herself and informed me that she would be asking me about myself and describing the position I'd applied for. I told her about my background and experience and she asked me some questions. She was very easy to talk to and pleasant. Very professional as well. After a bit, she asked me if I had any final questions, which I did. Then we wrapped it up, she thanked me for my time. I thanked her for meeting with me. It was a very positive experience.
Interview Questions: Describe the events of a normal day in your previous position, how did you prioritize your duties and how did you and your coworkers support each other?

title: Procurement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and the following week a supervisor in the department called me for a quick phone interview. Next I had to pass two different assessments to love on to the video interview where I met with all supervisors and was asked typical interview questions. Great experience and very friendly!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Referral Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Grand Rapids, MI) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Smooth and easygoing. First step of the interview process was over the phone and the conversation that I had with my new manager was very easy. Very easy to talk to. Second part of the interview process was job shadowing and came in very confident and took lots of notes. Felt like I was very prepared.
Interview Questions: Asking for help- if I needed help who would I go to or if I’d feel comfortable asking for it.

title: Per Diem Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview by three people- the lead therapist, hiring manager and director. They asked standard procedure questions asking about prior experience and fit with job. They gave patient scenarios to solve out loud
Interview Questions: Why per diem over full time

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: The Trinity Health Human Resources Recruiter called to conduct a 15-20 minute phone screen.  This was  followed by an in-person interview with the manager, Human Resources Representative, and Controller.  An offer was extended and accepted.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself and what attracted you to this position.

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Multiple steps in interview. First is with HR to determine your eligibility. Then interview with multiple teams of management and other staff members for your final interview. Once through those interviews they then send you an offer letter if accepted.
Interview Questions:
What brought you into pharmacy?
What goals do you have in the medical field?

title: Student Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Wilmington, DE) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was good for the first interview. It was about 15 minutes or less. She give me the opportunity to ask questions. She asked questions about my experience and told me I was moving on for the next interview with the nurse manager. I am waiting for the nurse manager to call me for the video interview.
Interview Questions: Tell about yourself?  Why you choose them? Ask questions about clinical experience.

title: Mammographer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and then in person interview with head of radiology. Be sure to have your resume open because they will ask you questions about it on the phone interview.
Interview Questions: What is the most difficult thing about your current job?

title: Customer Service Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Columbus, OH) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Strange and pretty unprofessional process. Virtual interview but interviewers did not come on camera. Interviewer asked what would you do in xyz situation but provided no real content or background to formulate a good answer. Felt like I would have been an exceptional candidate but my time was wasted. No ill will-certainly their loss but they may want to look at the people they have interviewing and perhaps record a few interviews for training purposes.
Interview Questions: What I would do to fix their collection problem

title: Philanthropy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Livonia, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Long process overall with multiple interviews. Not a bad experience as the company communicated with me frequently. First with HR and eventually with the entire team which was my first time interviewing with so many people.
Interview Questions: The usual questions including times I had to work through a problem and how I solved it

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy. He truthful and honest and they'll ask simple questions and if you give easy answers you'll get the job and it'll be that simple for you and yeah
Interview Questions: What is your experience with this job

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very fast. An offer was provided and an acceptance was requested two days later. The interview itself felt light and fun with one or two situational questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself, please

title: Referral Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Hartford, CT) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: the interview was conducted via virtual interview. not long at all. offered the position on the spot. references and background check completed after being offered the position.  very easy going and no pressure at all.
Interview Questions:
why do you want to work for trinity health
how do you deal with conflict in the workplace

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: .Applied online, was called for a pre-screening interview with HR, was told I would be contacted via email if they wanted to proceed with a second interview. I was contacted for a second interview with the hiring manager and was told they would contact me if they wanted to move forward with the job. Took about a week but I got a call from HR with a job offer.
Interview Questions: How would you respond to a coworker saying they were unhappy with the company?

title: Multi Skilled Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and face to face with nurse manager of unit. Pretty standard stuff. It was done very early in the morning, which wasn't really a surprise. Overall not a bad interview.
Interview Questions: What are your future plans in nursing?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Hardly gave me an interview. Checked if I was licensed and then asked when I could start. Didn’t want to negotiate pay. I felt the manager at little control over it and saw it must be a revolving door.
Interview Questions: When can I start the position.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: I had a case interview and a behavioral interview all in one 30 minute call. The case was about introducing a new drug to market, and the interviewer helped when I needed help but also let me take chances and try some things out.
Interview Questions: We are introducing drug X to the market....?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview and then I was called into shadow.  I was hired on the same day. The whole process was very simple and it wasn't difficult in my opinion.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you

title: Lead Sterile Processing Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: After application submission about three weeks went by before I was contacted. First interview went well except they started interviewing me for the wrong position. Emailed to set up a call to discuss more questions I had and was pretty much offered the job and was told Hr would be in touch.  HR called the next day and offered an embarrassing low pay rate without any negotiation. An almost 50% pay cut to the penny.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to move to the area

title: Billing and Follow Up Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: It was simple and easy no issues. I had 2 interviews with them. The hiring decision just took a little longer but that's okay I have no complaints this is a crazy time in life with COVID
Interview Questions: They gave me a billing scenario

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Wasn’t stressful.Give opportunity to express my opinion.explained everything thoroughly .Explain about Hospital policy and gave chance to express my concern.Try to make me relaxed and manager was so friendly.would recommend this hospital
Interview Questions: Why did you choose nursing as your carrier?

title: Senior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: There was a series of interviews. 1. Interview with Talent Acquisition Team 2. Two interviews with managers: 2a. Behavioral Interviews addressing candidate's career, getting to know candidate personally, and determining whether candidate would be a fit with the department's culture. 2b. Case study analysis 3. Interview with Directors
Interview Questions: Review your work history Share a moment when your persevered

title: Diversity and Inclusion Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had one interview with a recruiter via telephone and then a second with the hiring manager via zoom. It was a decently quick process, but based on my interview with the recruiter I was surprised to get a second interview., there was no real follow-up from her.
Interview Questions: How would I handle an environment that was formal?

title: Regional Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Boise, ID) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough through multiple panels and hands on demo. A number of current associates were present as well as Senior Leadership, interviews were staggered over multiple days and found that process to be very positive
Interview Questions: Lots of questions regarding my leadership abilities

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Poor management did not communicate well. Short staffed all the time. Mandate people nearly every shift. When call for help nobody even answers. Pay is much less then other companies. Benefits are good but expensive.
Interview Questions: They asked if I was ok being mandated.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Very detailed but friendly people. Interesting questions. What to do at some different situations or if there is a problem with peers .how I handled differently complicated situations. What I like the best about my previous job .................................
Interview Questions: What was the biggest challenge at your previous employment

title: Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT) Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: No interview. The hiring manager talked about the hospital, the community, and how big the military is here because of the base and that was about it. I was called back a week later that I got the job.
Interview Questions: Questions were not really asked.

title: Med Lab Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Amherst, MA) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: My interviewer was great! Very personable and up front. The hiring process is quite complicated due to Corona. All of the work is printed by you. But other administrators Request you reach out to them bc they know it’s more difficult now.
Interview Questions: How long are you working in the field.

title: Medical Biller Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: After playing phone tag for a week and a half just to have the interview, the interview was quick and brief by phone as they were hiring a lot of people for the role and they didn't want to meet in person.
Interview Questions: Why did you leave your last poition?

title: Biomedical Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Hartford, CT) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: I entered the Hospital and met with the director, manager, and lead technician. The director was very nice but the manager was yawning and looking at his phone the whole time. The manager seemed to wear many hats within the organization. They wanted to move forward but the HR person asked me to fill out a form that was supposed to be completed with the application but was missed due to an error. I completed the desired salary field and the HR person called me back two weeks later stating they can not pay what I am asking. I asked if they would be able to discuss further but did not hear back. 3 weeks later, the application status online changed to I withdrew from the process. Not a good experience.
Interview Questions: The questions were very customer service focused

title: Medical Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Trinity Health in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Group interview, very comfortable. The staff was very welcoming. We had to wait awhile for everyone to get there. It seemed that they had put a lot of thought into the position.
Interview Questions: Examples of previous patient challenges.

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: They scheduled a time to interview me over the phone. The interviewer reviewed my background, asked me why I wanted to leave my current position, discussed the position I was applying for, discussed the general availability, informed me that they would let me know.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to leave my current position.

title: Revenue Management Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Pleasant experience, a few phone/Teams interviews and the final round is in person. Personable interviewers and leadership throughout the process. Offer received about a week after the final round interview
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time that you have worked with manipulating data, and how you used it to tell a story.

title: Human Resources & Benefits Administration Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview involved 6 people and they had a list of several questions to cover in the hour.  This is my second invterivew with this organization and both were similar formats. Be prepared to provide detailed answers to specific questions.
Interview Questions: Industry specific questions

title: Lpn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Quick response with thorough follow through process. Was unable to get call but voicemail was greatly detailed. And also an email was sent as well with details as well. I have not returned the call as of yet do to the hour but i also have referred the company to my peers due to the quick response of submitting the application
Interview Questions: Only voicemail received unable to get call. Request an set block of time to shadow the whole process.

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Muskegon, MI) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was over zoom. My manager seemed very personable and knowledgeable about the questions I asked. She sounded accommodating to my needs. Overall I think the interview lasted 40 minutes with questions at the end.
Interview Questions: What are your personality traits?

title: Director of Informatics Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Trinity Health in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application on the company website. Was contacted by a recruiter within a few days. Recruiter set up interview with panel within a few days. The panel consisted of Directors of IT, clinical, process improvement, pharmacy and doctors.
Interview Questions: Is there anything on the job description that you would not be able to do or would need additional education or training to accomplish.

title: HR Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health (South Bend, IN)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with the Area Director of Human Resources, 2 in-person interviews - one interview with the Director of Nursing and another interview with the Executive Director, long orientation (boring).  Orientation was all day.
Interview Questions: No questioning really.  a few questions about HR stuff and that was really it.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Minot, ND) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview were on Skype, I had 3 interviews from Rehab, ICU and Critical Care units. The interviewers were all very pleasant and professional. I was interviewed. The interviewers, carefully went through my skills list and communicated clearly what they required on the end
Interview Questions: About what to expect life to be  in North Dakota

title: Supply Chain Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Ann Arbor, MI) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Quick interview, nothing out of the ordinary just be prepared and confident. Typical questions you would expect from an interview just make sure you prepare and you will be just fine!
Interview Questions: How well do you work with others?

title: Registration Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Steubenville, OH) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: First they call or email you and see if your still interested in the job then ask when you are available for a phone interview. If you do well then you will get asked for a face to face interview.
Interview Questions: If you could change something from your last job what would it be

title: Billing and Follow-up Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call to discuss my previous experience about two weeks after applying to the position. I was given the option to set up an alternate time to have the discussion. They were pretty standard interview questions.
Interview Questions: How have you dealt with difficult coworkers in the past?

title: Performance Management Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Trinity Health in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview with HR recruiter, followed by 2 more phone interviews with Director and Manager. The first two interviews were common phone interview questions, but the manager actually emailed me two "test" documents as we were on the phone. This was not previously discussed or mentioned at all. The manager emailed two documents, one was a revenue cycle accounting question and the other was a report with graphs and numbers. The total time for both questions were about 15 minutes. Not sure how an accounting question on the spot is relevant to performance management, especially if it's unexpected and over the phone.
Interview Questions: Revenue Cycle Accounting Mathematical formula to solve about gross revenue and A/R

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied for jobs I was clearly qualified for. Had 2 interviews. Never heard back from them. VERY UNPROFESSIONAL. No feedback given as to why I was not selected for the positions I applied for.  The only thing I can think of why I was not selected was they did not want someone with experience so they can pay less.
Interview Questions: What kind of experience do you have

title: Revenue Management Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: This interview process was average. It started off interviewing with team members then you interview with the hiring manager. Come prepared with good questions and explain why your qualification and skillsets fit the role. Show your personality. They want to get a feel for the type of person they will be working with.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Procurement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview with leaders from different departments, everyone went around asking questions. They asked regular entry level interview questions and offered time at the end for you to ask them questions. They said they would call in about a week.
Interview Questions: Name a time where you had to overcome adversity in the workplace?

title: Front Office Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Athens, GA) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: After submitting a resume and filling out an online survey, I chatted with the manager hiring over the phone and I was invited to an in person interview. The company strongly believes in peer interviews, so for me I had a couple of other office staff as well as someone from the back along with the manager in my interview.
Interview Questions: Asked lots of questions about how I handle stress and being in a fast pace environment and what I would do in certain situations. There is a huge emphasis on teamwork so also some discussion on what it’s like to be in a good team and bad team.

title: Diversity & Inclusion Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Livonia, MI)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very pleasant.  The process consisted of a phone interview and 2 on-site interviews.  The hiring manager and team were very welcoming and engaged in the processed.
Interview Questions: What does Diversity & Inclusion mean to you?

title: SVP Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted by a recruiter and subsequently had a 2-hour conversation with them.  The conversation was very beneficial and subsequently made me wanting to learn more about Trinity.  Unfortunately, the senior recruiter said that they would come back to me with an update in 5-6 weeks’ time.  After waiting for that period of time, I had not had an update and subsequently followed up the recruiter with two emails…. I heard nothing.
I am conscious that people are busy, however, the level of disrespect that companies and recruiters are showing potential employees (regardless of the level of the role) is simply appalling and unacceptable.  In this instance the organization did not display the “mission and values” that it proposes to be based itself on.
Interview Questions: Q. How do you work with others

title: Sourcing Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Livonia, MI) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Upon arrival, the security professional assisted to the first round of interview. All  of the questions were behavioral and situation based questions. Nothing technical as such. I was not selected, since they had an internal employee switch the department.
Interview Questions: What was the most difficult situation you faced and how you handled it.

title: Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Springfield, MA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Applied - July 18
First interview (with hiring manager) - July 31
Second interview (meet the team) - August 16
Final interview (with VP) - August 24

Overall, the process went very smoothly. This position was for Mercy Medical Center in Springfield, MA. I’m very excited to start my new job!
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: IT Contractor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Livonia, MI) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Screened by S3 then interviewed by phone: Introductions, discussions, questions, next steps, thank you then I received offer letter and many documents to sign (ie code of conduct, drug test, background, credit check, disclosure, benefits election, handbook form, I9 etc). The start date in my letter was weeks ago. No explanation or updated start has been provided.
Interview Questions: Most recent type of work; strengths

title: Pharmacy Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Steubenville, OH) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the directory, had a tour, then negotiated timing and when I would work. It was a nice experience.  I would recommend by far to anyone that asked me about the interview.
Interview Questions: What type of pharmacy do you see yourself working in?

title: Clinical Informatics Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Livonia, MI) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: After applying online through the portal found on their website, a representative from the organization reached out to me a few weeks later and scheduled an in-person interview with a panel of Clinical Informatics professionals at the organization. Interviewers were very kind and easy-going. Be prepared to talk specifically about what work you're interested in within Clinical Informatics.
Interview Questions: How do you manage your workload? What is your greatest strength?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Honestly one of the best interviews I’ve ever had. There were none of those ridiculous situational questions.  It was purely an interview about what I could bring to the table and I appreciated that.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Livonia, MI) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Panel with hiring manager and Team Lead. They made the environment comfortable and it was because I was an internal candidate. The innterview lasted 30 min.  The questions were based on character and experience.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Senior Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Livonia, MI) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back.  Questions were asked as well as time allotted for me to ask questions.  Interviewers were east to talk to.  Questions I had were either answered or taken off-line and answered then.
Interview Questions: What would I gain from being employed by Trinity

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Trinity Health in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview was challenging , there was an online test followed by personal interview and then group interview. Personal interview was being conducted by the hiring manager and technical lead. Technical written test was mostly around scripting language and Structured query language.
Interview Questions: Interview was challenging , there was an online test followed by personal interview and then group interview. Personal interview was being conducted by the hiring manager and technical lead.

title: Accounts Payable Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview was pretty laid back with basic behavioral questions. She was very easy to talk to and she tried to make you feel comfortable from the moment she comes to get you. Ask questions as well! I had her talking for around an hour. Said that Human Resources would be in contact from here on out and it can be a longer process regardless, so be patient.
Interview Questions: Explain what an invoice, statement, and credit memo are.

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was somewhat dragged out. At first I had a phone screen that lasted about 30-40 minutes. Standard interview questions were asked during that call, plus some general insight on the position itself. After passing that screen I went on site and interviewed several managers and directors over the course of two-three hours. First was the director of the department. That part lasted an hour or so. Then I spoke with several managers of the department or another solid block of time. It just felt very drawn out...
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions

title: Broken Technical Interview Process Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health (Livonia, MI) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I just had a technical interview here and it was... bad, like 1995 bad. They had a guy interview me that didn't understand the complexity of his own questions, and was definitely not ready to consider alternatives to his own answers.  For example, he asked if there was a difference between a NULL field and empty string field in SQL. He just couldn't comprehend that a char field will still allocate bitmap space for an empty string.  He sighed loudly and rolled his eyes at me for the rest of the interview, but not before arguing with me that a CROSS APPLY operator will return more results from the left table than a LEFT OUTER JOIN.
Interview Questions: What's the difference between global and local identifiers in SQL?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Boise, ID)
Interview Descriptions: Fairly straightforward, asked standard interview questions, there was really no surprise in the interview process other than one manager asking me why I thought I was worth the higher portion of the pay range
Interview Questions: How I handled conflict

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Ontario, OR) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Called in for interview day after I applied. Interviewed with 2 people both very friendly. Asked basic questions like why are you interested in medical field, how would you ask someone to pay, work availability.
Interview Questions: how much do you know about this job

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Albany, NY) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was great but it does take some time during the hiring process.  You have to be patient during the hiring process!  After the initial interview with the hiring manager he has me interview with a few of the employees
Interview Questions: How could I benefit Trinity Health?

title: Financial Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Pontiac, MI) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied on website.. About 2 weeks letter was contacted via email by HR department for phone interview. Set up Phone Interview lasted about 10 min.. General questions asked. HR department told me my resume would be forwarded to Hiring Manager. Hiring Manager called later that day to schedule Interview. Interview wasn't difficult. General questions were asked.  ** They decided to go with internal candidate.. They at least called and told me  versus just sending the standard email..
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about your past work experience?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: You apply for a position and their are hospital recruiters who get in touch with hiring nurse managers to see if they can get you an interview. Then you get a call. I had 2 interviews on 2 different units. The 1st interview, I was called by the recruiter and set up everything up. The 2nd interview, I was contacted directly by the nurse manager of the unit. You go in, complete the interview, and then someone will contact you back within 1-2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Why did you want to become a nurse?

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Waterbury, CT) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: There were 4 people in the interview. it was almost 45 minutes long and asked scenario based and behavioural type  questions like why did you choose this profession? how would you act in such situation?
Interview Questions: tell me about some interesting patient you saw in ED?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Minot, ND)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a smooth process and salary had to be negotiated. The manager was more than accommodating especially with school schedule. The hiring manager was very pleasant and made me feel comfortable while going through the interview process
Interview Questions: Background experience, interpersonal skills, and hours of availability

title: Administrative Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Do not do a first round interview. If you are selected as a finalist, they will fly you out to the headquarters to conduct one 50 minute interview. It felt hard to understand the organization with only having one short interview and without getting to see the hospital where you would be working.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Trinity?

title: Clinical Applications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was quick and painless. Got offered the job on the spot. Mainly just question and answer type interview. One on one. Met other colleges after the interview had concluded.
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you with teaching others?

title: Environmental Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Germantown, MD) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I received an email stating that the recruiter had received my application for the position, along with a request that I call and speak to her if I was still interested.  I contacted her, she offered me an appointment to come in & meet with department head.  I made appointment and went in person for a one on one interview.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work for Holy Cross Hospital?

title: Healthcare Administration Fellowship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Livonia, MI) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewing with Trinity was an enjoyable time.  Know your interviewer, about the organization (and the specific fellowship position), and prepare a good list of questions to ask. Participate in the social mixer on the night before the interview as it allows time with current and former fellows for questions, making connections, and gaining valuable insight. My interview was specific to the Health Informatics fellowship position.
Interview Questions: What kind of data have you managed and how?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Waterbury, CT) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied for a position for the Telemetry unit initially, they hired from within, so I didn't get that position, but they liked me so much, when I applied for the SAT CNA position, I got an interview with the supervisor.  She was fantastic.  The hiring process was a breeze.
Interview Questions: What are your best qualities and how can you incorporate them into this position?

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Boise, ID)
Interview Descriptions: I had an initial phone interview with the hiring manager. Once selected, I interviewed with a team of managers and other project managers. Each person on the panel took turns asking questions. I was asked about my knowledge of IT infrastructure, project management skills and healthcare knowledge.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Trinity Health?

title: Procurement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter called me and set up a phone interview. Next day had phone interview. Few days later was informed of a skills assessment had to complete online (Microsoft excel and a time management scenario) Few days later had a 4 person in person panel interview asked standard interview questions. Very friendly staff. Few days later was asked to verify employment and references done by a third party email generated process. Received job offer few days later. Now being sent for drug screening .
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Customer Service Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with the director, supervisor, and two other current employees. Entire interview was them taking turns reading questions off of a packet of questions and taking notes, which made it seem impersonal. They didn't really ask much about my past experiences other than to tell them about my previous job, they didn't ask for specifics or more detail nor did they stray from the questions on the paper (only around 8 questions total). They did say there was a lot of movement that happens there with people changing jobs and departments within the company, not sure if that was a good or bad sign.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Litigation Paralegal Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Livonia, MI) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Had a few interviews with a couple of the department heads at the same time. However the interview was a very standard interview and not difficult at all if your confident in your skills.
Interview Questions: Honestly  I can not recall the most difficult question, so it must not had been extremely difficult. If you are confident in your self and your skills you should not have any problems.

title: Administrative Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Onsite interview happens depending on how you prioritized your facility locations and concentrations. Behavioral questions that you would expect plus some specific questions regarding your specific choices. At this point they consider you the cream of the crop and if they had the resources they would hire all the final round candidates so it's really an interview session to see if you will fit in culturally. They are one of the few fellowships that promote the fact that retaining talent after the fellowship is important.
Interview Questions:
Tell me why you would fit in this role.
Why do you want to be at Trinity?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Albany, NY) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and it was a pretty standard interview process, asked about my experience with medical office work. Asked pretty standard questions including what I knew about the position, my skills, past work experiences
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself

title: Director of Supply Chain Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Trinity Health in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I first interviewed with someone from HR. They asked me to walk them through my resume and then highlight key experiences that pertained to the job I was applying for.

I then interviewed with the network wide supply chain manager. He asked me more specific behavioral based questions to understand my decision making processes.
Interview Questions: How do you convince a group of people to try a new way of doing something?

title: IS Service Desk Analyst I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Livonia, MI) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied multiple times over a six month period for the Service Desk position. I finally got a call after two weeks from my third/fourth attempt. Quick phone interview and person to person interview was scheduled within a week with the supervisor of the shift and the team lead. Interview was a good one. The supervisor made sure to lay out all the good and bad of the job. Found out I was hired a week after the interview. Hiring process was long and could use some work. It took almost a month after I accepted the offer to actually start. Still, the process overall was pleasant.
Interview Questions: Have you heard of Trinity Health before you applied?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Waterbury, CT) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: It took a long time to get an interview.  The nurse recruiter in human resources is either unorganized or in need of an assistant.  There is no follow up after the interview unless you call human resources or if they want to offer you a job immediately.  It seems like your name could easily get lost in the shuffle.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 2 years?

title: Procurement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Livonia, MI) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was some intense, but not uncomfortable. They asked questions about my previous experience. They also asked personality questions. An example why did I resign from my previous employer.
Interview Questions: Give an example of where you were asked to work in a team?

title: Applications Delivery Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Livonia, MI) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Walked into a room with 8 people asking me 1 to 2 questions. Each person asked there technical question and then moved on to the next person. People asking questions were potential co workers.
Interview Questions: Describe your past technical experiences with your previous employer.

title: Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Waterbury, CT) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: disorganized; unprepared.  Pleasant staff and atmosphere; no follow up from interview received; had to call HR to determine the status of the position; hospital employees very pleasant and helpful
Interview Questions: WHy this position

title: Diet Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Springfield, MA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I got a call back in 3 days. I went in for my interview and she just talked to me about my availability and then I got the job. Not much of an interview. She showed me around the kitchen and introduced me to people. The process took about 2 weeks and they do drug test.
Interview Questions: What is your availability?

title: Payer Analytics Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Livonia, MI) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a 30 minute phone screen followed up by an hour on site interview. Just some behavioral questions to understand if you would be a good fit in the company. Overall, it was a simple process and the whole company is extremely nice.
Interview Questions: When did you face a time in your career where you were challenged and how did you handle this?

title: Credentialing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Livonia, MI) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview with two department managers. They were laid-back and made you feel comfortable. It felt more like a two-sided conversation than an interview. I wrote a thank you email to the managers the next day and I received a job offer about a week later.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current job? What are you looking for in a manager? What do you dislike in a manager? What is your greatest weakness?

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Waterbury, CT) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was very low key and friendly. The Supervisor was very informative and helpful. Down to Earth. She told me about the company and exactly what she was looking for in the position. She knew my resume.
Interview Questions: Tell me something that you accomplished in your former job?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Springfield, MA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: After filling out the interview online, they emailed me a week later to set up an in person interview. After the interview they followed up the following week to meet with the rest of the team. After meeting each individual team member, another week passed and HR called with the offer. After a little negotiation I accepted the terms and came in to fill out the paperwork. I started the following week with orientation being my first day.
Interview Questions: Its a very religious institution, so they ask about your values and how they online with their mission. That being said, they are surprisingly accepting.

title: IT Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very relaxed. Just be professional, be yourself, and if your resume exactly matches the job description you will be fairly considered. This was a very standard interview process based on my previous experiences.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Livonia, MI) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with HR and then ADON, after brief review of experience I was told about job description and offered position. I was told about mandation policy, staffing ratios, and holiday rotation. Please be aware that this company participates in mandatory over time and it happens quite often!
Interview Questions: What do I struggle with the most regarding being a CNA?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Livonia, MI) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: A 2 phase interview using behavioral style questions. There was a panel of five employees of varying relationships that took turns asking the questions.  For phase 2 that was with two individuals and the questions were asked in a less formal manner.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to priories multiple tasks and projects, what were they and how did you come to your decision?

title: Data Scientist I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Trinity Health (Livonia, MI) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: The on site interview went very well and everyone on the panel was very friendly and receptive. However, after the interview, they contracted out the background check, and whoever performed this did a very poor job. For example, having worked at my previous place of employment for around 7 years, they were only able to confirm two months of this employment, so I am very confident that they performed a background check for an entirely different person.
Interview Questions: What specific skills do you bring to the team that will make you most valuable to the department.

title: Dietary Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions:
The operations manager called me about two days after I applied online. She's such an incredible woman. We scheduled an interview for two days later. The interview was rather long, as it exceeded 45 minutes. She explained the specifics of the position and asked me questions primarily related to my work history. A few weeks later, she called me for a second interview . This time however, she wasn't there, three staff members took her place. This was rather intimidating but it was all very simple stuff. The questions were work-history related only. I think I only got 2 personal questions. Another few weeks later, I received a call from HR telling me that I got the job. Then I went to their Occ. Ther. center for TB testing and 3 immunizations. 
Please be aware that this process was long. I applied in April, and started in late May. They have enough employees to cover for a long while. Also, the operations manager is so overbooked (I don't think it's her fault however).
Interview Questions: "Do you enjoy working with people or by yourself?" and "What do you ultimately want to do in life?"

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Trinity Health
Interview Descriptions: phone interview
Interview Questions: tell me a joke

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Livonia, MI) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: panel and 1:1 interview, lasted 4 hours, interview taken by 5 people from the department. Asked about the skills, how those skills are used with the past work experience, education and future plans.
Interview Questions: typical interview questions covering experience, team work, functional area knowledge

title: Director of Education Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Grand Rapids, MI) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview process consisted of meeting with the Administrator and DON for approximately 2 hours. I had received a call the week before asking me to come in for the interview. I arranged to do so. Received a job offer within 2-3 days of the interview itself.
Interview Questions: Why did I want this job? What value could I bring to the job?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Minot, ND) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I went to the floor I was interviewing for and was ignored by everyone there. When I finally got someone's attention they turned around and walked away. (I assumed to call the supervisor because she came out shortly after). I was interviewed in her shared small and cramped office. It was messy and uncomfortable.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in the NICU? (After telling them my long answer they offered me a position in post partum)

title: Mental Health Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Holyoke, MA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions:
-Found job openings through Indeed.com
-Went to company website and created an account, and applied for relevant jobs therein, submitting resume, job history, mission statement, demographic information, education history, etc
-Response came as email
-I called and set up interviews
-I was interviewed for three positions and offered one of the jobs
Interview Questions: "What would say are your three biggest weaknesses?"

title: Executive Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Livonia, MI) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter does an initial phone screen interview; a second phone interview; 1-2 face-to-face interviews in which the recruiter will alert you of whether or not you will be offered the job.
Interview Questions: I was not asked any difficult or unexpected questions

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I received a call back the come in for an interview. I received a tour of the unit and hospital. I filled out a lot of paperwork.
Interview Questions: They asked about my availability.

title: Applications Support Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Novi, MI) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: You sit down in a conference room filled of all your potential teammates sitting around you, they then went around the table asking questions about your resume, the entire time trying to gage how you will work along side your possible coworkers. Each one had a question they were supposed to ask and a varaiy of topics on the white board behind me. By the end of it we all laughed a few times and it was the most fun I ever had in an interview.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work at Trinity? They then asked about my work experience, more concerned with my ability to mesh with my coworkers than my experience.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Ann Arbor, MI) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and went to the hospital to talk to the unit manager before I got hired. I don't know if it helped but the process went fairly quick.
Interview Questions: There were a lot of behavioral and personality questions such as: how do you handle difficult situations? how do you handle issues with co-workers?

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Trinity Health (White Lake, MI) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Online application, Interviewed by one director
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Business Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Baltimore, MD) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: its was not so bad, it was a short interview and it was over the phone and its was a Skype call interview, i answered the questions very well, though it was a bit tricky but i got the job
Interview Questions: they asked about the projects i worked on

title: Registered Nurse ICU Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Springfield, MA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: organized and easy
Interview Questions: none of the questions were difficult

title: Plant Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (New Hampton, IA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions:
phone interview
one on one interview
team interview
Interview Questions: What would I like to change about my life.

title: Director of Quality and Patient Safety Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Springfield, MA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was thorough and rigorous. I was asked back twice and the entire process took over a month. The former Director had been in the position for many years, so the hiring of a new Director included staff that ultimately reported to me. The onsite interviews included two group interviews with both staff reporting to me and Senior Management Team Colleagues
Interview Questions: What would you do first when you arrive?

title: JCAHO Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Waterbury, CT) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Individual interview with hiring manager with whom I had done with with before.  My hiring was related to highly specialized JCAHO regulation and accreditation preparation.  A discussion about the current state of JCAHO survey readiness took place as did a discussion about dedicated resources for preparation.
Interview Questions: Am i familiar with the most current JCAHO Accreditation guidelines

title: Clinical Applications Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Livonia, MI) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Brief, First Phone then 1-1. No big deal, Then with HR.
Just a general conversation, Cool , Don't get too anxious. This is not some high tech company trying to assess every bit of detail. If you don't know just say you don't know. Be cool! They appreciate you for who you are. Don't make up.  I must say at the time I joined, I felt like TRINITY was like a family. They treated me like a close family member. No tricks. No back stabbers.
Interview Questions: General questions, They will talk with you and judge your personality. Be careful.

title: Desktop and Network Support - Tech I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Clinton Township, MI) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews. The first interview was with the manager and the top two associates and the second interview was with the entire team.
Interview Questions: I was asked many technical questions, but the one that threw me off was - what is the difference between the north and south bridge on a computer.

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Farmington Hls, MI) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Contacted by recruiter via email to schedule phone interview. The phone interview was 45 min. long and consisted of standard questions:
Why do you want this position?
What skills do you bring to the position?
Walk through of my resume highlights
What has been your most rewarding accomplishment? 
How would you evalute your ability to deal with conflict?
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you were faced with problems or stresses that tested your coping skills.

title: Resident Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Brighton, MI) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process was very professional, I was asked all of the correct questions I felt should have been asked.
Interview Questions: What is your worst asset?

title: Med Tech II, Clin Labs Blood Bank Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Trinity Health (Maywood, IL) in Jun 2008
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume online to Loyola. I was contacted by telephone to schedule a date and time for an interview. They were very efficient in that the basic Human Resources interview and the interview with the hiring manager and supervisor were all scheduled for the same day. I was required to take a written examination to determine my suitability for the position as well as my overall work ethic, attitude, best fit, and other considerations. I felt that the entire process was handled thoroughly and efficiently. I left without any questions regarding the position and responsibilities. Once references were checked, I was offered the position. This part of the process took only two weeks.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question is the same one I encounter at all interviews; my salary requirements. Since I felt that this position was vital to my professional and personal growth, I had a difficult time answering that.
